business.headline: After Mumbai, Tesla to open showroom in Delhi's Aerocity on August 11The Delhi showroom will be opened at Worldmark 3 in Aerocity for customers. Like the Mumbai showroom, this showroom is also expected to serve as a display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.

Tesla's brand loyalty took a hit after Musk backed Trump as US President: ReportThe data shows Tesla's customer loyalty peaked in June 2024, when 73% of Tesla-owning households in the market for a new car bought another Tesla, according to an S&P analysis of vehicle-registration data in all 50 states.

Sunjay Kapur's death: Mother alleges foul play, transnational conspiracy in letterSunjay Kapur passed away on June 12 while playing polo at the Duke's Ground of the Old Guards Polo Club in Surrey, UK. His death was officially described as a heart attack. However, his mother Rani now claims there may be more to the story.

How to activate UAN via UMANG app to access EPFO servicesEPFO now requires everyone to activate their UAN through the UMANG app using Aadhaar-based face authentication to access provident fund services.

Tesla offers Elon Musk $29 billion deal to stay onboardIn 2018, Tesla had promised Musk a huge $50 billion pay package if he hit certain performance goals. But earlier this year, a court in Delaware cancelled that deal, saying the company's board didn't do a fair job protecting shareholders when they approved it.

ED's crackdown on Anil Ambani, web of bank frauds: All you need to knowThe fraud case centres around unpaid loans amounting to nearly Rs 17,000 crore, which were taken by various firms linked to Anil Ambani. Officials are now trying to trace the money trail and who were all involved in diverting it.

Are you unemployed or studying? Should you file taxes this yearIf your total income is below the basic exemption limit, Rs 2.5 lakh under the old tax regime or Rs 3 lakh under the new one, you are not legally required to file an ITR. This means many students and unemployed individuals fall outside the mandatory filing bracket.
Sensex closes 418 points higher, Nifty above 24,700; Tata Steel ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex added 418.81 points to close at 81,018.72, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 157.40 points to end at 24,722.75.

TCS to cut 12,000 jobs in FY26: Why are mid-level IT jobs at risk?Experts believe TCS layoffs point to a broader structural change where automation and AI are beginning to take over routine tasks, leading to a change in the type of roles companies want to retain and the kind of talent they want to hire.

ED probes banks in Rs 17,000 crore loan fraud linked to Anil AmbaniThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating why 39 banks failed to report a loan fraud of ₹17,000 crore linked to companies of businessman Anil Ambani. The agency suspects that the banks' silence may have been bought. The central question being investigated is, "Was there a certain bribe that was paid to the banks to buy their silence?" The ED has asked the banks to explain their inaction, especially when the loans turned into non-performing assets (NPAs). As the money laundering investigation mounts, Anil Ambani has been summoned to appear on the 5th of August. The ED has also summoned his top executives and close aides, including Amitabh Jhunjhunwala and Satish Seth, believing they hold key information on how the alleged frauds and payment of bribes occurred.

RTI reveals how much PSU banks spend on recovery agentsIndia Today filed a Right to Information (RTI) query with the Department of Financial Services (DFS) to uncover how much taxpayer-funded public sector banks are spending on recovery agents.

Old vs new tax regime: What's better for you in FY 2024–25?With the ITR filing deadline extended to September 15, 2025, you've got more time to pick the right tax regime. Should you stick to the old one with its deductions, or go for the new one with lower rates?

ED summons Anil Ambani's top aides; probes banks over Rs 17,000 crore loan fraudDays after summoning Anil Ambani, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has now issued summons to several of his top executives for questioning under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

'Mango Millionaire' authors Radhika Gupta, Niranjan Avasthi on SIPs, investing and moreIn this exclusive Q&A interaction, Gupta and Avasthi reflect on the core ideas in their book, the pitfalls of social media-driven investing, why SIPs still matter, and what India needs to change in the way it talks about money and long-term wealth.

Buying Dubai property with credit cards? Why many Indians are now in troubleSeveral homebuyers either clicked on payment links shared by Dubai-based builders or swiped their credit cards during their visits to the UAE. It felt hassle-free, no paperwork, no visits to the bank. But there's a catch. Read here to know more.

HCLTech CEO earned Rs 95 crore: Here are India's highest-paid IT bossesHCLTech also reported a 17.6% increase in the median pay for its employees during the financial year. HCLTech currently has 1,67,316 permanent employees.

Dehlivery shares rally up to 5% after Q1 results. Should you buy?Delhivery shares jumped 5% in early trade after the company posted its Q1FY26 results. Should you buy into the rally or wait and watch how the integration and margins play out?

Sri Lotus Developers IPO allotment today: Check your status, GMP, listing dateThe IPO of Sri Lotus Developers received a strong response during its three-day bidding window, with total subscriptions reaching 74.10 times.

Explained: How Trump's tariffs are hurting the US economyWith inflation rising and global backlash mounting, data suggests Trump's tariff blitz is straining the American economy, casting doubt on his promise to 'make it great again'.
Sensex opens 160 points higher, Nifty above 24,600; BEL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 229.73 points to 80,829.64, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 81.55 points to 24,646.90 as of 9:24 am.

JSW Cement IPO price band announced. Check other detailsJSW Cement's IPO includes a fresh issue of 10.88 crore shares worth Rs 1,600 crore and an offer for sale of 13.61 crore shares worth Rs 2,000 crore. The company had initially aimed to raise Rs 4,000 crore, but later reduced the issue size.

RBI MPC begins today: Will US tariffs trigger a rate cut?The RBI's August MPC is meeting after cutting interest rates by 100 basis points across its last three policy meetings. The policy stance has remained 'neutral'.

NSDL IPO allotment today: Check your status, GMP and listing dateInvestors who applied for NSDL shares can check their allotment status either on the BSE website or the website of the registrar, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime).

Personal loan for wedding? Why borrowing for the big day needs rethinkingA wedding is a beautiful milestone, but is it worth starting your new life under a mountain of debt? With the rising trend of using personal loans to fund lavish celebrations, it's time to rethink the cost of saying "I do."

Explained: Why India shouldn't lose sleep over Trump's 25% tariffsIndia shouldn't trade its future for short-term calm. Trump's tariff move is more noise than policy. Staying firm now will protect India's strength and choices in the long run.

May consider dividends to citizens: Trump on tariff revenue disbursal plansTrump has signed a new executive order that imposes fresh import tariffs on goods from 69 countries and the European Union, which will come into effect on August 7.

Loan fraud case: ED issues lookout notice against Anil AmbaniA lookout circular has been issued against Anil Ambani at the request of the Enforcement Directorate (ED), preventing him from travelling abroad without court permission.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.
Vandana Vasudevan on how tech is reshaping daily lifeSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan explains how this shift is changing daily routines.

OTP Please! The double-edged sword of digital living: Vandana VasudevanSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan tells how tech has changed how we live, making travel easier for the disabled, food more accessible, and work more flexible. But she warns of fading community bonds, unhealthy habits, and insecure gig jobs. Tech must support life, not replace human connection.

US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

Elon Musk's Starlink to operate soon in India. Check monthly plansUnion Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia confirmed that Starlink has been awarded a Unified Licence to launch its satellite internet operations in India.
Sensex closes 586 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Infosys ends 3% downThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 585.67 points to close at 80,599.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203 points to end at 24,565.35.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

Jane Street not cooperating in probe with income tax department: ReportThe firm's servers are located outside India, and officials said they are unable to access them. Additionally, accounts books are also being maintained overseas, even though company law requires them to be kept in India.

Planning to buy a car without taking loan? Here's how you can do itThink you need a big salary or bank loan to own a car? Think again. A thoughtful plan, regular savings, and side gigs helped one man save Rs 7.1 lakh in three years, all without borrowing a rupee. Here's how you can do it too.

Explained: Why PNB Housing Finance Ltd shares crashed 18% todayPNB Housing Finance Ltd share crash: The steep fall followed days of weak performance. Over the past five days, the stock has lost 19.59%, and in the last month, it has dropped 26.53%.

New tax rules coming soon. How the Income Tax Bill 2025 could impact youThe new law aims to make income tax rules easier to understand, reduce legal disputes, and help people comply with tax rules more easily.

Sebi may relax IPO float norms for big firms to just 2.5% equity: ReportAt present, Sebi rules say that any company with a post-issue capital of more than Rs 1 lakh crore must offer 5% equity and raise at least Rs 5,000 crore.

entertainment.headline: Vivek Agnihotri says Sandeep Reddy Vanga is his alter ego: He is showing the truthDirector Vivek Agnihotri defended 'Animal' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga's storytelling approach. He claimed that Vanga is criticised because of jealousy over his success rather than his content.
Adivi Sesh, Emraan Hashmi's G2 gets a release date. See new posterActor Emraan Hashmi, Adivi Sesh, and Wamiqa Gabbi's much-anticipated spy thriller 'G2' gets a release date.

Rajinikanth compares Lokesh Kanagaraj to SS Rajamouli at Coolie eventRajinikanth praised Lokesh Kanagaraj at the Telugu pre-release event of 'Coolie'. He compared him to SS Rajamouli ahead of 'Coolie's release on August 14.

Priyanka Chopra to team up with Bhansali for Love & War? Here's what we knowPriyanka Chopra is rumoured to be a part of Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Love & War'. However, as per an industry source, the reports are untrue.

Stranger Things Seasson 5 twist revealed, setting up wildest cold open yetNetflix is set to release the highly anticipated fifth season of 'Stranger Things' in three instalments. The makers dropped a major hint about the new seaosn.

Sabrina Carpenter performs at Lollapalooza with Earth, Wind and Fire bandSinger Sabrina Carpenter's performance at Lollapalooza is taking social media by storm. She performed with the Chicago-based band Earth, Wind, and Fire. Her videos from the event are going viral.

Hrithik Roshan is all praise for War 2 co-star Jr NTR, calls him incredibleActor Hrithik Roshan spoke highly of co-star Jr NTR at an event in Sri Lanka and the video is now going viral. The much-anticipated film from the YRF Spy Universe, 'War 2' will be released on August 14.

Jatadhara 1st look: Sonakshi Sinha enters a mythic supernatural realmThe first poster of Sonakshi Sinha's 'Jatadhara' is out. The poster shows the clash of mortal and mythical in a supernatural realm.

Kerala Minister V Sivankutty questions National Award snub for AadujeevithamEducation Minister V Sivankutty questions the omission of the Malayalam film Aadujeevitham from the National Film Awards. The controversy highlights possible jury politics and technical criticisms surrounding the film.

Aamir Khan hosts movie night with his Coolie gang, watches Sitaare Zameen ParBollywood actor Aamir Khan got together with his 'Coolie' team to watch 'Sitaare Zameen Par' in his vanity van after the recent pre-release event that took place in Chennai. Lokesh Kanagaraj, Nagarjuna, Shruti Haasan, Upendra and others can be seen in the pictures.

Farah Khan flirts with Boman Irani in latest vlog, jokes about casting couchThe recent YouTube video of filmmaker Farah Khan featured flirtatious exchanges with actor Boman Irani. She also joked about casting couch in the video. Khan also warned her long-time cook Dilip not to tell her husband about her banter with the actor.

Faisal Malik says RGV, Anurag Kashyap changed the game for struggling actorsFaisal Malik praised Ram Gopal Varma and Anurag Kashyap for changing Bollywood's beauty standards by casting average-looking but talented actors. He also spoke about Kashyap's deep love for cinema and his uncompromising nature when it comes to his craft.

Korean actor Song Young-kyu found dead weeks after DUI caseKorean actor Song Young-kyu was found dead inside his car weeks after a DUI conviction. His death has sparked renewed discussions on mental health and media pressure in South Korea's entertainment industry.

Mahua Moitra fangirls over Pankaj Tripathi, says wanted to meet him over coffeeTrinamool MP Mahua Moitra revealed her admiration for actor Pankaj Tripathi, calling him her crush and praising his versatile roles. She even tried to meet him over coffee and enlisted Ravi Kishan's help for a call, but got too shy to speak much.

Saare Jahan Se Accha: Pratik Gandhi as RAW agent trying to prevent world warThe 'Saare Jahan Se Accha' trailer features Pratik Gandhi portraying a RAW agent. He embarks on a dangerous mission deep within enemy territory in Pakistan.

Aadujeevitham director slams Ashutosh Gowariker's U-turn after National Awards snubDirector Blessy expressed disappointment over 'Aadujeevitham - The Goat Life' being overlooked at the National Film Awards. The controversy stems from director Ashutosh Gowariker's earlier praise contrasting with jury concerns about the film's adaptation and execution.

Mahavatar Narsimha: How a Made-in-India animation film is rewriting historyDirector Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha' raced past Rs 100 crore globally in less than two weeks. The animated film, made in India, is based on the story of Lord Vishnu's Narsimha avatar.

Devoleena Bhattacharjee shares adorable video with baby son, says I manifested itActor Devoleena Bhattacharjee shared a sweet video holding her newborn son, Joy, calling him her 'manifestation.' She and her husband Shanawaz Shaikh welcomed their baby boy in December 2024.

Hansal Mehta compares Mumbai with Colombo: How long will we live like thisFilmmaker Hansal Mehta criticised Mumbai's poor infrastructure and public indifference after returning from a shoot in Colombo. Comparing the two cities, he questioned how long people would continue accepting chaos and decay as normal.

general news.headline: Trump threatens to substantially raise tariff on India for buying Russian oilUS President Donald Trump threatened India with higher tariffs for buying oil from Russia and selling it on the open market for big profits.

Nothing will happen tomorrow: Omar Abdullah amid J&K statehood buzzThe buzz around J&K's statehood to be restored started after President Droupadi Murmu had back-to-back meetings with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

Warrior Siraj conjures up magic as India win Oval thriller, level series 2–2England vs India: India secured a dramatic victory in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy final at the Oval. Mohammed Siraj's five-wicket haul sealed a six-run win in an hour of madness on Monday in London.

After Mahua Moitra's 'pig' jibe, Kalyan Banerjee's furious post and a resignationTrinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee responded to Mahua Moitra's statement where she referred to him as "pig", calling them dehumanising and unfortunate. He also resigned as the party chief whip in Lok Sabha.

Anil Ambani's battle for reckoningWe revisit the Ambani legacy settlement saga following the Enforcement Directorate's first arrest linked to a multi-crore loan fraud case against Anil Ambani's companies

Sunjay Kapur's death: Mother alleges foul play, transnational conspiracy in letterSunjay Kapur passed away on June 12 while playing polo at the Duke's Ground of the Old Guards Polo Club in Surrey, UK. His death was officially described as a heart attack. However, his mother Rani now claims there may be more to the story.

Cracks widen in Trinamool as Kalyan Banerjee quits as chief whip of Lok SabhaAccording to sources, Banerjee said he received a call from TMC national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee, who requested him to continue as chief whip for a few more days.

Shabash to our heroes: Shashi Tharoor apologises to Team India after Oval Test winExpressing his exuberance at the win, he said that the Indian team displayed grit, determination and passion during the course of the match.

Reality of Gaza hunger games explained as starvation kills scoresOnly the politics of depravity feeds on hunger and starvation. That's exactly what is happening in Gaza, where Israeli forces are firing at hungry thousands who rush for the limited aid. Photos of starved children dying are flooding social media even as Israel keeps blaming Hamas for stealing food meant for civilians. Photos of emaciated Israeli hostages have added to the puzzle.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

After Mumbai, Tesla to open showroom in Delhi's Aerocity on August 11The Delhi showroom will be opened at Worldmark 3 in Aerocity for customers. Like the Mumbai showroom, this showroom is also expected to serve as a display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.

What exactly is BJP's Malviya lecturing Mamata on amid Bangla row?As a letter by the Lodhi Colony Police Station to the Banga Bhawan in Delhi requesting an official to help understand "Bangladeshi language" sparked a political storm, BJP leader Amit Malviya tutored West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Bangla. But what exactly was Malviya, who called Mamata "poorly lettered", trying to explain to the native speaker of Bangla?

Virat Kohli thrilled for Mohammed Siraj, reacts to Oval Test victoryVirat Kohli applauded India's sensational victory at the Oval. Kohli took to Twitter to share his joy, and gave special mention to Mohammed Siraj.

Mahavatar Narsimha: How a Made-in-India animation film is rewriting historyDirector Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha' raced past Rs 100 crore globally in less than two weeks. The animated film, made in India, is based on the story of Lord Vishnu's Narsimha avatar.

Can Rahul's Babbar Sher Gaurav Gogoi win Assam from Himanta?By bringing in Gaurav Gogoi as its Assam unit president, the Congress is planning to put up a big fight against the BJP in the 2026 Assembly polls. Will the plan, with a definite Rahul Gandhi imprint, help the Congress win Assam from Himanta Biswa Sarma and BJP, or will it be just fireworks with little gain?

Emotional Siraj reacts after helping India to thrilling Oval win: Always believedAfter helping India bowl England out for 367 and seal an astonishing six-run win in the final Test at The Oval on Monday, Mohammed Siraj said he had always backed himself to deliver in crucial moments.

Maximum city, maximum kabutars? Mumbai bans pigeon feeding, protests take flightA Bombay High Court order directing the closure of kabutarkhanas has given flight to controversy, protests, as well as the first FIR for feeding pigeons. This issue has sharply divided Mumbai, pitting animal welfare activists against daily commuters. Read our explainer on this issue till the end and let us know your take on the subject.

No trademark for Op Sindoor yet, Defence Ministry seeks special protection of logoIn response to a series of questions raised by Member of Parliament Sagarika Ghose in the Rajya Sabha, the government on Monday clarifief that no trademark application for Operation Sindoor has been approved yet.

Court closes corruption case against AAP's Satyendar Jain as CBI finds no evidenceThe case pertains to the allegations levelled against Jain and others for illegally hiring professionals to the Public Works Department (PWD), during the AAP leader's tenure as Delhi's PWD minister.

Centre's DDLJ policy: Congress fumes after court raps Rahul Gandhi on China remarkCongress leader Jairam Ramesh posed a series of questions to the government on its handling of China and accused it of following a "DDLJ" policy -- Deny, Distract, Lie, and Justify.

Kishore Kumar's wild journey: From flop auditions to Bollywood's singing GodKishore Kumar ruled the stage like a rock star, but his career began with rejection of his signature style that defied norms.

Soldier and his cousin mistaken for criminals, thrashed by locals in UPThe two men were identified as Mohan, an Army jawan posted in Manipur, and his cousin Roshan. Mohan was home while on a leave and had set out with Roshan on a motorcycle to visit their relatives in Saharanpur.

Tesla offers Elon Musk $29 billion deal to stay onboardIn 2018, Tesla had promised Musk a huge $50 billion pay package if he hit certain performance goals. But earlier this year, a court in Delaware cancelled that deal, saying the company's board didn't do a fair job protecting shareholders when they approved it.

She even tried to meet him over coffee and enlisted Ravi Kishan's help for a call, but got too shy to speak much.

Adivi Sesh, Emraan Hashmi's G2 gets a release date. See new posterActor Emraan Hashmi, Adivi Sesh, and Wamiqa Gabbi's much-anticipated spy thriller 'G2' gets a release date.

Priyanka Chopra to team up with Bhansali for Love & War? Here's what we knowPriyanka Chopra is rumoured to be a part of Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Love & War'. However, as per an industry source, the reports are untrue.

sports.headline: Draw against England gives Gautam Gambhir lifeline: GavaskarLegendary Sunil Gavaskar said that Gautam Gambhir has been given a lifeline after India managed to draw England in the Test series. Gambhir's position was under question due to several tactical blunders over the past 12 months in red ball cricket.

35 runs from hell: How Shubman Gill's India scripted epic comeback at OvalIndia defended just 35 runs on the final day of the 5th Test match at Oval. Shubman Gill and Mohammed Siraj broke down India's plan coming into Day 5 and how they bowled an incredible set of 53 deliveries to demolish England.

We will never surrender: Gautam Gambhir's first reaction to India's Oval Test winIndia vs England, 5th Test: Head coach Gautam Gambhir took to social media to laud the young team's fighting spirit after they won the Oval Test by six runs. India fought back from 1-2 down to level the series and retain the trophy.

AIFF calls upon eight ISL clubs on August 7 to discuss issues in Indian footballThe All India Football Federation (AIFF) has summoned the chief executives of eight Indian Super League (ISL) clubs for a meeting on 7 August in New Delhi, amid mounting concerns over the uncertain future of Indian football.

How Cristiano Ronaldo wallpaper fuelled Mohammed Siraj's Oval Test heroicsEngland vs India, 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj revealed he searched for an inspiring wallpaper on Google before the start of play on Monday. The Hyderabad pacer picked up a 5-wicket haul as India won a thriller at Oval by six runs.

2-2 is fair: Ben Stokes says amazing series shows Test cricket is not dyingEngland captain Ben Stokes took his side's agonising six-run defeat to India on the chin, admitting that a 2-2 series draw was a fair result after one of the most fiercely contested Test campaigns in recent memory. Stokes insisted the series served as a powerful reminder that the longest format of the game remains as compelling as ever.

2 wins without Kohli, Bumrah: Ex-cricketers share stark reminder to fansIrfan Pathan reminded Indian cricket fans that the game will move forward regardless of the biggest superstars. This comes after India's iconic win at the Oval thanks to Siraj's heroics on the final day.

Virat Kohli thrilled for Mohammed Siraj, reacts to Oval Test victoryVirat Kohli applauded India's sensational victory at the Oval. Kohli took to Twitter to share his joy, and gave special mention to Mohammed Siraj.

Watch: Wearing lucky jacket, Sunil Gavaskar erupts in joy after India win Oval TestEngland vs India: Sunil Gavaskar erupted with joy as India clinched a thrilling six-run win at The Oval, proudly pointing to the white jacket he had worn as a lucky charm.

Best series I've witnessed: McCullum after dramatic end to Oval TestENG vs IND 5th Test: Brendon McCullum reckons that the England vs India Test series was arguably one of the best five-match affairs he has ever been a part of. The series ended in a tie with both teams winning two games each.

Captain Shubman Gill will take India to great heights: KL RahulKL Rahul hailed Shubman Gill's leadership after India's Oval win, calling him a tactically sharp captain who led from the front and has the potential to take the Indian Test team to great heights.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
